name: Morbent Manor
description:
Morbent Manor is a dungeon-crawling roguelike that I built in Unity as part of my master's dissertation, achieving a first class grade of 80%. 
 The game features procedurally generated levels, a variety of enemies, and explores a unique MOBA-style combat system. I also created and animated many custom assets using Aseprite and Unity's robust state machine system. 
 The game is available to play as a demo on itch.io. If you would like to learn more about the game, read my dissertation or look at the source code, please feel free to contact me.

name: Kitchen Feud
overview: Online team-based cooking game built in Unity
description:
Kitchen Feud is an online team-based cooking game built in Unity. Along with 5 other developers, we created this game during our 3rd year at University. 
 Inspired by Overcooked, the game features a competitive cooking environment where players follow recipes to earn points, and are encouraged to sabotage the enemy kitchen to maximize their score. 
 The full game is available to play using the demo link below, along with the source code and final report on GitHub.

name: Warcraft Portfolio
overview: Portfolio creation tool for World of Warcraft characters
description:
Warcraft Portfolio helps players to create a portfolio for their World of Warcraft characters, to help streamline the process of applying to guilds and when reading applications. 
 This tool aims to provide the most important and valuable information so recruiters don't need to trawl through many different websites to find the information they need. 
 Built ontop of SvelteKit, the tool fetches data from WarcraftLogs and Raider.io's API.

name: C++ Rendering Engine
overview: Rendering engine built in C++ with SDL2 and GLM
description:
A rendering engine created from scratch using C++, with SDL2 for drawing to screen and GLM to assist with vector and matrix operations. 
 The engine features some basic implementations of rendering techniques used by modern renderers including rasterization, ray tracing, phong shading and more.

name: Sensitivity Converter
overview: Tool to convert mouse sensitivity between games
description:
A tool to help users to convert their mouse sensitivity between different games. 
 I've often found that the converters available have too many bells and whistles, making it confusing or frustrating to use when you just want to convert your mouse sensitivity. This tool focuses on offering an extremely simple interface built on React, to do the job as quickly and easily as possible.

name: Letterboxd Rec
overview: Accurate Movie recommendations, built using Go
description:
Letterboxd Rec is a tool to help provide accurate movie recommendations based on Letterboxd favourites. 
 When provided a single movie, the tool uses a web scraper to concurrently gather data from users who hold the movie highly, i.e. in their 'top 4' favourites. 
 To try and explore the performance of web apps using a non-JavaScript based framework, I built it entirely using just Go and htmx.

name: AWS Rendering Farm
overview: Rendering farm for Blender built with AWS
description:
Helps speed up the process of rendering Blender projects using AWS instances. 
 Using AWS EC2 instances as workers, the tool splits work so blender files can be rendered distributively. Includes options to render portions of files, and even includes a 'chaos testing' mode to simulate how the tool perseveres through heavy failure/load.

name: Graphing Calculator
description: Graphing Calculator is a tool that allows users to graph equations and functions. The tool features a variety of graphing options, and allows users to easily input and visualize mathematical functions. The tool is built using Python and Pygame.

name: Ale Trail
overview: Pub crawl tracking app for Android devices
description: Ale Trail is a pub crawl tracking app for Android devices. The app features a variety of pub crawl routes, and allows users to track their progress and earn rewards. The app is built using Android and Kotlin.

name: Director Spectrum
overview: Showcase of different film director styles
description: Director Spectrum is a tool that showcases the different styles of film directors. The tool features a variety of directors and allows users to explore their filmography and style. The tool is built using Svelte and TypeScript.
